import { Editor, excludedProps } from '@looker/storybook'
import { ArgsTable, Meta } from '@storybook/addon-docs'
import { Table } from '@looker/visualizations-table'
import horizontalScrollStory from '!!raw-loader!./TableHorizontalScroll'
import basicStory from '!!raw-loader!./TableBasic'
import pivotStory from '!!raw-loader!./TablePivot'
import truncatedTextStory from '!!raw-loader!./TableTruncatedText'
import wrappedTextStory from '!!raw-loader!./TableWrappedText'
import multiSortStory from '!!raw-loader!./TableMultiSort'

<Meta component={Table} title="Visualizations/Docs/Table" />

# Visualizations: Table

The Table data visualization can be rendered by setting config type to `table`.

<Editor code={basicStory} />

## Grouped/pivoted columns

<Editor code={pivotStory} />

## Wrapped text

By default, the Table visualization will wrap long headers and cell content into multiple lines.

<Editor code={wrappedTextStory} />

## Truncated text

If you wish the header text or cell text to be contained to a single line, set `truncate_header` and `truncate_text` to `true`.

<Editor code={truncatedTextStory} />

## Column Sorting State

The Table visualization can sort by multiple columns simultaneously.

<Editor code={multiSortStory} />

## Horizontal virtual scrolling

When your dataset is very wide, as in the case of a pivoted query with many columns, the Table visualization utilizes horizontal scroll virtualization to maintain page performance.

<Editor code={horizontalScrollStory} />

<ArgsTable of={Table} exclude={excludedProps} />
